            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_1">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Securities
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_2" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p>(Last updated 14 Nov 2022)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_2">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_3" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Making available to you any advertisements, marketing or promotional materials is part of our Bank’s ordinary course of securities dealing business. It shall not, by itself, constitute solicitation of the sale or recommendation of any investment products.<br> <br> Investment involves risk. Notwithstanding the benefits of offer(s) mentioned herein, you should carefully consider the risks and features of any investment products (including but not limited to equities/exchange traded funds/exchange traded derivatives & structured products) or services mentioned herein to assess whether they are appropriate for you in view of your investment experience, objectives, financial resources and relevant circumstances. The price of investment products may move up or down. Losses may be incurred as well as profits made as a result of buying and selling investment products.</p> 
<div>
 <strong>For Renminbi (RMB) products:</strong>
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>There may be exchange rate risks if you choose to convert RMB payments made on the securities to your home currency.</li> 
 <li>RMB products may suffer significant losses in liquidating the underlying investments if such investments do not have an active secondary market and their prices have large bid/ offer spreads.</li> 
 <li>In general, RMB equity products are exposed to the usual kind of default risks that might be associated with equity products denominated in other currencies.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_1" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_1" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1044866681__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h4 id="1044866681__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Securities </h4>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1044866681__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_3">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_4" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_4" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>1. Risk of Securities Trading</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The prices of securities fluctuate, sometimes dramatically. The price of a security may move up or down, and may become valueless. It is as likely that losses will be incurred rather than profit made as a result of buying and selling securities.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>2. Risk of Trading Futures and Options</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The risk of loss in trading futures contracts or options is substantial. In some circumstances, you may sustain losses in excess of your initial margin funds. Placing contingent orders, such as "stop-loss" or "stop-limit" orders, will not necessarily avoid loss. Market conditions may make it impossible to execute such orders. You may be called upon at short notice to deposit additional margin funds. If the required funds are not provided within the prescribed time, your position may be liquidated. You will remain liable for any resulting deficit in your account. You should therefore study and understand futures contracts and options before you trade and carefully consider whether such trading is suitable in the light of your own financial position and investment objectives. If you trade options you should inform yourself of exercise and expiration procedures and your rights and obligations upon exercise or expiry.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>3. Risk of Trading Growth Enterprise Market Stocks</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Growth Enterprise Market (GEM) stocks involve a high investment risk. In particular, companies may list on GEM with neither a track record of profitability nor any obligation to forecast future profitability. GEM stocks may be very volatile and illiquid.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should make the decision to invest only after due and careful consideration. The greater risk profile and other characteristics of GEM mean that it is a market more suited to professional and other sophisticated investors.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Current information on GEM stocks may only be found on the internet website operated by The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited. GEM Companies are usually not required to issue paid announcements in gazetted newspapers.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should seek independent professional advice if you are uncertain of or have not understood any aspect of this risk disclosure statement or the nature and risks involved in trading of GEM stocks.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>4. Risks of Client Assets Received or held outside Hong Kong</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Client assets received or held by the licensed or registered person outside Hong Kong are subject to the applicable laws and regulations of the relevant overseas jurisdiction which may be different from the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap.571) and the rules made thereunder.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Consequently, such client assets may not enjoy the same protection as that conferred on client assets received or held in Hong Kong.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>5. Risk of Providing an Authority to repledge your Securities Collateral etc</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is risk if you provide the licensed or registered person with an authority that allows it to apply your securities or securities collateral pursuant to a securities borrowing and lending agreement, repledge your securities collateral for financial accommodation or deposit your securities collateral as collateral for the discharge and satisfaction of its settlement obligations and liabilities.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your securities or securities collateral are received or held by the licensed or registered person in Hong Kong, the above arrangement is allowed only if you consent in writing. Moreover, unless you are a professional investor, your authority must specify the period for which it is current and be limited to not more than 12 months. If you are a professional investor, these restrictions do not apply.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Additionally, your authority may be deemed to be renewed (i.e. without your written consent) if the licensed or registered person issues you a reminder at least 14 days prior to the expiry of the authority, and you do not object to such deemed renewal before the expiry date of your then existing authority.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are not required by any law to sign these authorities. But an authority may be required by licensed or registered persons, for example, to facilitate margin lending to you or to allow your securities or securities collateral to be lent to or deposited as collateral with third parties. The licensed or registered person should explain to you the purposes for which one of these authorities is to be used.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you sign one of these authorities and your securities or securities collateral are lent to or deposited with third parties, those third parties will have a lien or charge on your securities or securities collateral. Although the licensed or registered person is responsible to you for securities or securities collateral lent or deposited under your authority, a default by it could result in the loss of your securities or securities collateral.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A cash account not involving securities borrowing and lending is available from most licensed or registered persons. If you do not require margin facilities or do not wish your securities or securities collateral to be lent or pledged, do not sign the above authorities and ask to open this type of cash account.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>6. Risk of providing an authority to hold mail or to direct mail to third parties</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you provide the licensed or registered person with an authority to hold mail or to direct mail to third parties, it is important for you to promptly collect in person all contract notes and statements of your account and review them in detail to ensure that any anomalies or mistakes can be detected in a timely fashion.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>7. Risk of Margin Trading</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The risk of loss in financing a transaction by deposit of collateral is significant. You may sustain losses in excess of your cash and any other assets deposited as collateral with the licensed or registered person. Market conditions may make it impossible to execute contingent orders, such as "stop-loss" or "stop-limit" orders. You may be called upon at short notice to make additional margin deposits or interest payments. If the required margin deposits or interest payments are not made within the prescribed time, your collateral may be liquidated without your consent. Moreover, you will remain liable for any resulting deficit in your account and interest charged on your account. You should therefore carefully consider whether such a financing arrangement is suitable in light of your own financial position and investment objectives.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>8. Risk of Trading Nasdaq-Amex Securities at The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The securities under the Nasdaq-Amex Pilot Program ("PP") are aimed at sophisticated investors. You should consult the licensed or registered person and become familiarised with the PP before trading in the PP securities. You should be aware that the PP securities are not regulated as a primary or secondary listing on the Main Board or the Growth Enterprise Market of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>9. Additional Risk Disclosure for Futures and Options Trading</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This brief statement does not disclose all of the risks and other significant aspects of trading in futures and options. In light of the risks, you should undertake such transactions only if you understand the nature of the contracts (and contractual relationships) into which you are entering and the extent of your exposure to risk. Trading in futures and options is not suitable for many members of the public. You should carefully consider whether trading is appropriate for you in light of your experience, objectives, financial resources and other relevant circumstances.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">9.1 Futures<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(i) Effect of "Leverage" or "Gearing"</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transactions in futures carry a high degree of risk. The amount of initial margin is small relative to the value of the futures contract so that transactions are "leveraged" or "geared". A relatively small market movement will have a proportionately larger impact on the funds you have deposited or will have to deposit: this may work against you as well as for you. You may sustain a total loss of initial margin funds and any additional funds deposited with the firm to maintain your position. If the market moves against your position or margin levels are increased, you may be called upon to pay substantial additional funds on short notice to maintain your position. If you fail to comply with a request for additional funds within the time prescribed, your position may be liquidated at a loss and you will be liable for any resulting deficit.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(ii) Risk-reducing orders or strategies<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The placing of certain orders (e.g. "stop-loss" orders, or "stop-limit" orders) which are intended to limit losses to certain amounts may not be effective because market conditions may make it impossible to execute such orders. Strategies using combinations of positions, such as "spread" and "straddle" positions may be as risky as taking simple "long" or "short" positions.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">9.2 Options<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(i) Variable degree of risk</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transactions in options carry a high degree of risk. Purchasers and sellers of options should familiarise themselves with the type of option (i.e. put or call) which they contemplate trading and the associated risks. You should calculate the extent to which the value of the options must increase for your position to become profitable, taking into account the premium and all transaction costs.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The purchaser of options may offset or exercise the options or allow the options to expire. The exercise of an option results either in a cash settlement or in the purchaser acquiring or delivering the underlying interest. If the option is on a futures contract, the purchaser will acquire a futures position with associated liabilities for margin (see the section on Futures above). If the purchased options expire worthless, you will suffer a total loss of your investment which will consist of the option premium plus transaction costs. If you are contemplating purchasing deep-out-of-the-money options, you should be aware that the chance of such options becoming profitable ordinarily is remote.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Selling ("writing" or "granting") an option generally entails considerably greater risk than purchasing options. Although the premium received by the seller is fixed, the seller may sustain a loss well in excess of that amount. The seller will be liable for additional margin to maintain the position if the market moves unfavourably.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The seller will also be exposed to the risk of the purchaser exercising the option and the seller will be obligated to either settle the option in cash or to acquire or deliver the underlying interest. If the option is on a futures contract, the seller will acquire a position in a futures contract with associated liabilities for margin (see the section on Futures above). If the option is "covered" by the seller holding a corresponding position in the underlying interest or a futures contract or another option, the risk may be reduced. If the option is not covered, the risk of loss can be unlimited.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Certain exchanges in some jurisdictions permit deferred payment of the option premium, exposing the purchaser to liability for margin payments not exceeding the amount of the premium. The purchaser is still subject to the risk of losing the premium and transaction costs. When the option is exercised or expires, the purchaser is responsible for any unpaid premium outstanding at that time.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>10. Additional Risks common to Futures and Options</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.1 Terms and conditions of contracts</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should ask the firm with which you deal about the terms and conditions of the specific futures or options which you are trading and associated obligations (e.g. the circumstances under which you may become obliged to make or take delivery of the underlying interest of a futures contract and, in respect of options, expiration dates and restrictions on the time for exercise). Under certain circumstances the specifications of outstanding contracts (including the exercise price of an option) may be modified by the exchange or clearing house to reflect changes in the underlying interest.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.2 Suspension or restriction of trading and pricing relationships<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Market conditions (e.g. illiquidity) and/or the operation of the rules of certain markets (e.g. the suspension of trading in any contract or contract month because of price limits or "circuit breakers") may increase the risk of loss by making it difficult or impossible to effect transactions or liquidate/offset positions. If you have sold options, this may increase the risk of loss.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Further, normal pricing relationships between the underlying interest and the futures, and the underlying interest and the option may not exist. This can occur when, for example, the futures contract underlying the option is subject to price limits while the option is not. The absence of an underlying reference price may make it difficult to judge "fair value".<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.3 Deposited cash and property<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should familiarise yourself with the protections given to money or other property you deposit for domestic and foreign transactions, particularly in the event of a firm insolvency or bankruptcy. The extent to which you may recover your money or property may be governed by specific legislation or local rules. In some jurisdictions, property which had been specifically identifiable as your own will be pro-rated in the same manner as cash for purposes of distribution in the event of a shortfall.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.4 Commission and other charges<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Before you begin to trade, you should obtain a clear explanation of all commission, fees and other charges for which you will be liable. These charges will affect your net profit (if any) or increase your loss.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.5 Transactions in other jurisdictions<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transactions on markets in other jurisdictions, including markets formally linked to a domestic market, may expose you to additional risk. Such markets may be subject to regulation which may offer different or diminished investor protection. Before you trade you should enquire about any rules relevant to your particular transactions. Your local regulatory authority will be unable to compel the enforcement of the rules of regulatory authorities or markets in other jurisdictions where your transactions have been effected. You should ask the firm with which you deal for details about the types of redress available in both your home jurisdiction and other relevant jurisdictions before you start to trade.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.6 Currency risks<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The profit or loss in transactions in foreign currency-denominated contracts (whether they are traded in your own or another jurisdiction) will be affected by fluctuations in currency rates where there is a need to convert from the currency denomination of the contract to another currency.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.7 Trading facilities<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Electronic trading facilities are supported by computer-based component systems for the order-routing, execution, matching, registration or clearing of trades. As with all facilities and systems, they are vulnerable to temporary disruption or failure. Your ability to recover certain losses may be subject to limits on liability imposed by the system provider, the market, the clearing house and/or participant firms. Such limits may vary: you should ask the firm with which you deal for details in this respect.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.8 Electronic trading<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Trading on an electronic trading system may differ from trading on other electronic trading systems. If you undertake transactions on an electronic trading system, you will be exposed to risks associated with the system including the failure of hardware and software. The result of any system failure may be that your order is either not executed according to your instructions or is not executed at all.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">10.9 Off-exchange transactions<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In some jurisdictions, and only then in restricted circumstances, firms are permitted to effect off-exchange transactions. The firm with which you deal may be acting as your counterparty to the transaction. It may be difficult or impossible to liquidate an existing position, to assess the value, to determine a fair price or to assess the exposure to risk. For these reasons, these transactions may involve increased risks. Off-exchange transactions may be less regulated or subject to a separate regulatory regime. Before you undertake such transactions, you should familiarise yourself with applicable rules and attendant risks.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>11. Risk of Trading Warrants and Callable Bull/Bear Contracts</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Warrants and Callable Bull/Bear Contracts (CBBCs) are structured products which involve derivatives.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You rely on the creditworthiness of the issuer of warrants and/or CCBCs. Subject to both the actual and perceived measures of the credit worthiness of its issuer and, there is no assurance of protection against a default by its issuer in respect of its payment obligations. Upon insolvency of the issuer, you may get nothing back and the potential maximum loss could be 100% of the investment amount and no return may be received.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are warned that the prices of warrants and CBBCs may fall in value as rapidly as it may rise and holders may sustain a total loss of their investment. CBBCs have a mandatory call feature and may therefore be subject to early termination, upon which (i) investors in category N CBBCs will lose all of their investments in the CBBCs; and (ii) the residual value of category R CBBCs may be zero.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Before you purchase any warrants and/or CBBCs, you should ensure you understand the nature of warrants and/or CBBCs and carefully study the full details and risk factors set out in the relevant listing documents and, where necessary, seek professional advice before you invest in any of these products. You should also ensure that you fully understand the potential risks and rewards and independently determine that they are appropriate for you given your objectives, experience, financial and operational resources and other relevant circumstances. You should note that The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited acting through its appointed liquidity provider may be the only market participant in HSBC-issued warrants and CBBCs.</p>
</div></div>

            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Certificates of Deposit (CDs)
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_6" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 21 Jun 2021)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_3">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_7" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Certificate of Deposit (i.e. CD) is NOT equivalent to a time deposit. It is NOT protected under the Hong Kong Deposit Protection Scheme.</li> 
 <li>Certificate of Deposit is subject to the actual and perceived measures of credit worthiness of the Certificate of Deposit issuer.</li> 
 <li>There is no assurance of protection against a default by the issuer. In the worst scenario, if the issuer defaults on the Certificate of Deposit, you might not be able to recover the principal and any coupon. The Certificate of Deposit holder has no recourse to HSBC unless HSBC is the issuer itself.</li> 
 <li>You should be prepared to hold your funds in the Certificate of Deposit for the full tenor.</li> 
 <li>The secondary market for a Certificate of Deposit may not provide significant liquidity or may trade at prices based on the prevailing market conditions, which may cause you to suffer loss if you choose to sell the Certificate of Deposit prior to maturity.</li> 
 <li>There may be exchange rate risks if you choose to convert payments on the Certificate of Deposit to your home currency.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">RMB CDs</span></strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated CDs, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>RMB product will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of RMB denominated underlying investments outside PRC is hence limited. These may adversely affect the product return and performance.</li> 
 <li>For RMB denominated debt instruments with non-RMB denominated underlying investment, they are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
 <strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL"><br> General reminder</span></strong>
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_10" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product. (added on 12 Aug 2019)<br> </li> 
 <li>Deposit Plus (i.e. DPS) is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>This product is not capital protected. The net return of the product will depend on the prevailing market conditions at the deposit fixing time. You must be prepared to incur loss as a result of depreciation in the value of the currency paid.</li> 
 <li>Early redemption of this product is not allowed. You have to place your funds in the product for the full deposit period.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>If HSBC becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of HSBC regardless of the performance of the underlying currency. In the worst scenario, you could lose all of your investment.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>RISK DISCLOSURE FOR RMB DPS</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_14" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product. (added on 12 Aug 2019)<br> </li> 
 <li>Capital Protected Investment Deposit – Currency Linked 3 (i.e. CPI 3) is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is principal protected only at maturity. Early redemption of the product is not allowed. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. <br> </li> 
 <li>The return of this product depends on the exchange rate performance of the chosen currencies upon fixing. You must be prepared to take the risk of earning a very low or no return on the money invested.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>If HSBC becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of HSBC. In the worst scenario, you could lose all of your investment.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>RISK DISCLOSURE FOR RMB CPI 3</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>RMB investment will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>The product may suffer significant losses in liquidating the underlying investments, especially if the underlying investments do not have an active secondary market.</li> 
 <li>This product (if denominated in RMB) will be denominated and settled in RMB deliverable in Hong Kong, which is different from that of RMB deliverable in Mainland China. CNY or CNH mentioned in the linked currency pair and exchange rate denotes the deliverable CNY in offshore market.</li> 
</ul>

    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_26" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product. (added on 25 Mar 2019)<br> </li> 
 <li>Daily Cash Dividend Callable ELI (i.e. DCDC ELI) is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured products involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>The product is not principal protected, you could lose all of your investment in extreme cases. The product is also not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset. Changes in the market price of reference assets may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The maximum return on termination of this product is limited to the nominal amount together with all periodic cash dividend paid during the scheduled tenor. You are exposed to change in the market price of the reference asset or the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets during the scheduled tenor.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If the autocall condition is satisfied, the product will be terminated and no further potential cash dividend amount will be payable. You may not be able to enjoy the same rate of return if you re-invest in other investments.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the potential cash dividend, autocall, etc will be determined by the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_29" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure For DCDC ELI Linked To ETF</p> 
<p class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:<br> If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the “China Connect”. Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive.</li> 
 <li>Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF’s value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_8">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="PRDUOGE"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Up&Out Growth Equity Linked Investment (ELI)
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_30" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 6 Nov 2023)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_9">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_31" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product. (added on 25 Mar 2019)</li> 
 <li>Up&Out Growth ELI is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured products involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is principal protected or partially principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. If the product is not fully principal protected, you could lose part of your investment. The product is also not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset. Changes in the market price of reference assets may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The potential return will only be paid if the Up&Out Barrier has been triggered OR final price of the reference asset or worst performing asset on the final valuation date is above the initial price. If such condition is not met, you will not receive the potential return. It is possible that you may not received any potential return for the entire scheduled tenor of the Up&Out Growth Equity Linked Investment.</li> 
 <li>The product is subject to a cap, your potential gain is limited. Performance of the reference asset may not be captured in the payout. If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the return will be determined by the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_9" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_9" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-2035092989__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-2035092989__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Up&Out Growth Equity Linked Investment </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-2035092989__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_18">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_32" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">General reminder</span></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a business day, the next following day that is a business day.</li> 
 <li>If the investment period of your product subscribed is more than 1 year, you have a right to sell back the product to the bank within the post-sales cooling off period (i.e. within 5 business days from and including the order subscription date). You will be able to get back the principal minus any negative market value adjustments and the handling charge (if applicable).</li> 
 <li>Secondly, the investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The Securities and Futures Commission (the 'SFC') has authorized the Equity Linked Investments and offering documents of Equity Linked Investments. The SFC’s authorization does not imply official recommendation or endorsement of Equity Linked Investments, nor does it guarantee the commercial merits of Equity Linked Investments or its performance. (added on 6 Apr 2019)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_33" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL"><br> Risk disclosure for RMB ELI</span><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_34" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL"><br> Risk disclosure For ELI Linked To ETF</span></strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the “China Connect”. Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li>

Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history.             <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_9">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="PRDFPPN46"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Private Placement Note 46 (PPN46) - stepdown autocallable structured note
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_35" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 21 Jun 2021)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_10">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_36" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product. (added on 25 Mar 2019)<br> </li> 
 <li>PPN46 - Step Down Autocallable Structured Note (i.e. Step Down Note) is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured products involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>The product is not principal protected, you could lose all of your investment in extreme cases. The product is also not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.<br> </li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s) and changes in the market price of reference assets(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The maximum return on termination of this product is limited to the nominal amount together with all periodic cash dividend paid during the scheduled tenor. You are exposed to change in the market price of the reference asset or the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets during the scheduled tenor.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If the autocall condition is satisfied, the product will be terminated and no further cash amount will be payable. You may not be able to enjoy the same rate of return if you re-invest in other investments.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the autocall, etc will be determined by the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1744940783__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1744940783__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Private Placement Note 46 </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1744940783__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_20">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_21" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_37" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">General reminder</span></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a HK business day, the next following day that is a HK business day. Please contact us if you wish to early sell-back.</li> 
 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents of the private placement notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer. (added on 6 Apr 2019)<br> </li> 
 <li>The private placement notes is available to Professional Investors only. (added on 6 Apr 2019)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_38" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure for RMB PPN</p> 
<p class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_39" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure for PPN linked to ETF</p> 
<p class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:<br> If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.<br> </li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the “China Connect”. Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive.</li> 
 <li>Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF’s value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF maybe highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_10">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="PRDFPPN47"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Private Placement Note 47 (PPN47) - up&out growth structured note
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_40" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 21 Jun 2021)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_11">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_41" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>PPN47 - Up&Out Growth Structured Note (i.e. Up&Out Note) is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured products involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term.</li> 
 <li>The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s). Changes in the market price of reference asset(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The potential return will only be paid if the Up&Out Barrier has been triggered OR final price of the reference asset or worst performing asset on the final valuation date is above the initial price. If such condition is not met, you will not receive the potential return. It is possible that you may not receive any potential return for the entire scheduled tenor of the Up&Out Note.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the return will be determined by the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>
