If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Private Placement Note 48 (PPN48) - autocallable fixed coupon structured note
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_45" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <div>
 (Last updated 21 Jun 2021)
</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_12">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_46" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>PPN48 - Autocallable Fixed Coupon Structured Note (i.e. Fixed Coupon Note) is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured products involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>The product is not principal protected, you could lose all of your investment in extreme cases. The product is also not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s). Changes in the market price of reference asset(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The maximum return on termination of this product is limited to the nominal amount together with all periodic cash coupon paid during the scheduled tenor. You are exposed to change in the market price of the reference asset or the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets during the scheduled tenor.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If the autocall condition is satisfied, the product will be terminated and no further cash amount will be payable. You may not be able to enjoy the same rate of return if you re-invest in other investments.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the autocall , etc will be determined by the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>

            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_12" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1124512628__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1124512628__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Private Placement Note 48 </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1124512628__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_24">

        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_25" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_47" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">General reminder</span></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a HK business day, the next following day that is a HK business day. Please contact us if you wish to early sell-back.</li> 
 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents of the private placement notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer.</li> 
 <li>The private placement notes is available to Professional Investors only.</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_48" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure for RMB PPN</span><br> If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_49" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure for PPN linked to ETF</span> </strong><br> If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:<br> If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the "China Connect". Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive.</li> 
 <li>Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF’s value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>PPN49 - Twin Win Shark Fin Structured Note with Floor (i.e. Twin Win Shark Fin Note) is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is principal protected OR partially principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. If the product is not fully principal protected, you could lose part of your investment. The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s). Changes in the market price of reference asset(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.  <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li>

Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li>

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for RMB PPN</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">

 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_54" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for PPN linked to ETF</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the "China Connect". Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive.</li> 
 <li>Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF’s value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_13">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Private Placement Note 50 (PPN50) – Digital Coupon Note
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_55" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 27 Mar 2023)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_14">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_56" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>This note is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>For Principal Protected or Partial Protected Note, it is principal protected OR partially principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. If the product is not fully principal protected, you could lose part of your investment.</li> 
 <li>For Non Principal Protected Note, it is not principal protected, you could lose all of your investment in extreme cases. <br _rte_temp_br="brEOB"> </li> 
 <li>The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s). Changes in the market price of reference asset(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product. You are exposed to changes in the market price of the reference asset, or if the product is linked to a basket of reference assets, changes in the market price of the worst performing asset of such basket for the bullish or range bound version of the note or the best performing asset of such basket for the bearish version of the note.</li> 
 <li>The potential gain is limited. Performance of the reference asset  may not be captured in the payout.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the return will be determined by the worst performing asset of such basket for the bullish and range bound versions of the note or the best performing asset of such basket for the bearish version of the note.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    </div>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_57" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>General reminder</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a HK business day, the next following day that is a HK business day. Please contact us if you wish to early sell-back.</li> 
 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents of the private placement notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer.</li> 
 <li>The private placement notes is available to Professional Investors only.</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for RMB PPN</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for PPN linked to ETF</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the "China Connect". Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive.</li> 
 <li>Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF’s value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents of the private placement notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer.</li> 
 <li>The private placement notes is available to Professional Investors only.</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for RMB PPN</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for PPN linked to ETF</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers. The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the "China Connect". Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive. Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF’s value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Private Placement Note 52 (PPN52) –  Twin Win Autocallable Note
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_61" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 26 Jun 2023)</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_16">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_62" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>This note is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is not principal protected, you could lose all of your investment in extreme cases.</li> 
 <li>The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s). Changes in the reference asset(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product. You are exposed to changes in the reference asset(s).</li> 
 <li>The note will be early redeemed and the Early Redemption Amount will be paid if the reference asset or worst performing asset is at or above the Autocall Barrier Level on Early Valuation Date. The potential performance return will only be paid if the final level of the reference asset or worst performing asset on the final valuation date is at or above barrier level, subject to the occurrence of any Early Redemption, and if the barrier has not been triggered during the investment period. The payout / amount will be the absolute performance of the reference asset or worst performing asset relative to the Initial Level. If such condition is not met, you will not receive the absolute performance return. If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If the early redemption condition is satisfied, the Early Redemption Amount will be paid and the Noted will be terminated. You will no longer hold the Note.</li> 
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the return will be determined by the worst performing asset.</li> 
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_17">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_65" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.<br></li>
 <li>PPN53 - Bonus Enhanced Note (i.e. BEN Note) is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured products involving derivatives.<br></li>
 <li>The product is not principal protected, you could lose all of your investment in extreme cases. The product is also not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.<br></li>
 <li>Buying this product is not the same as buying the reference asset(s) and changes in the market price of reference assets(s) may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product.</li>
 <li>It is possible that you may not receive any potential performance return for the entire scheduled tenor.</li>
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.<br></li>
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.<br></li>
 <li>If you invest in a product linked to a basket of reference assets, you are facing a higher risk than a product linked to a single reference asset as the potential cash dividend, redemption at maturity, etc will be determined by the worst performing asset of the basket of reference assets.<br></li>
 <li>You have no rights in the reference asset. If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.<br></li>
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and price movement of the reference asset.<br></li>
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

            <h3 id="-1631288834__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Private Placement Note 53 </h3>

        <section id="-1631288834__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_35">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_66" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">General reminder</span></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a HK business day, the next following day that is a HK business day. Please contact us if you wish to early sell-back.</li> 
 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents of the private placement notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer. (added on 6 Apr 2019)<br> </li> 
 <li>The private placement notes is available to Professional Investors only. (added on 6 Apr 2019)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_67" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure for RMB PPN</span><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_68" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Risk disclosure for PPN linked to ETF</span><br> </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing products linked to ETF, please take note of the following risk factors:<br> If the product is linked to or invests in synthetic ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Synthetic ETF invests in derivatives and customers are exposed to the risks relating to the index, the credit risk and potential contagion of the derivative issuers.</li> 
 <li>The market value of the collateral might fall substantially when the issuer seeks to realise the collateral.</li> 
 <li>Higher liquidity risk and wider bid-offer spreads are involved if the synthetic ETF involves derivatives which do not have an active secondary market. This may result in losses.</li> 
 <li>Failure of the tracking strategy, currency differences, fees and expenses etc may result in the disparity between the performance of the synthetic ETF and the performance of the underlying index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index/market that the synthetic ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the synthetic ETF to trade at a higher premium or discount to its net asset value. If the ETF terminates, investors may not be able to recover the premium.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in ETF, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Political, economic, currency and other risks related to the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the performance of the ETF and the performance of the underlying equity(ies), assets or index.</li> 
 <li>Where the index or equity(ies) or assets that the ETF tracks is subject to restricted access, the efficiency in unit creation or redemption may be disrupted, causing the ETF to trade at a premium or discount to its net asset value.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to/invests in REIT, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The REIT is exposed to the risks relating to investment in real estate</li> 
 <li>There may be disparity between the market price of the units of a REIT and the net asset value per unit.</li> 
</ul> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<div>
 <span class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the product is linked to or invests in China ETFs, and is associated with the following risks:</span>
</div> 
<div>
  
</div> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>This product is linked to units of a China ETF issued and traded outside the PRC which invests directly in A-shares through the RQFII regime and/or the "China Connect". Investing in this product linked to a China ETF may be riskier than investing in product linked to traditional ETFs.</li> 
 <li>The China ETF invests primarily in the PRC markets which involve concentration risk and other risks and special considerations not typically associated with investment in more developed economies or markets, such as greater risks related to political, tax, economic foreign exchange, liquidity, and regulatory.</li> 
 <li>The RQFII and China Connect prescribed by the PRC government policy and rules are new and subject to change. The uncertainty and any potential change of the laws and regulations in the PRC may adversely and retrospectively impact the China ETF as well as the product.</li> 
 <li>Trading of securities invested by the China ETF under China Connect will subject to a daily quota which does not belong to such China ETF and is utlized on a "first-come-first serve" basis. If the quota is reached, the manager may suspend creation of any China ETF unit. The liquidity of such China ETF may be affected and the China ETF may be trading in premium therefore and render the price of the Product more volatile. (added on 8 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>There are risks and uncertainties associated with the current Chinese tax laws applicable to investment made by China ETF.</li> 
 <li>The tax laws, rules, regulations and practice in PRC may subject to change and such change(s) may have retrospective effect. The units of such China ETF could become subject to additional taxation that is not anticipated at the trade date of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the China ETF may have made tax provisions in respect of potential tax liability that may arise from their investments, the provisions may not be sufficient or may even be excessive.</li> 
 <li>Any shortfall between the provisions and the actual tax liabilities may have to be covered by the China ETF’s assets and may adversely affect the China ETF's value.</li> 
 <li>In addition, any changes in tax policies of the PRC government may reduce the after-tax profits of the companies in PRC which the China ETF invests in and may adversely affect the net asset value of such China ETF which in turn may adversely affect the market value and/or any potential gain or loss of the product.</li> 
 <li>Although the units of the China ETF are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, there is no guarantee that an active trading market or liquidity of that market can be sustained. Also, the price and trading volume of the units of the China ETF may be highly volatile subject to the market sentiment, and may be more volatile than ETFs with a longer trading history. The risks may have a significant adverse impact on the performance of the units of a China ETF and the value of the product.</li> 
 <li>The ETF units are traded in both RMB and HKD under the Exchange’s dual counter model and may involve additional risks. If the product is linked to the HKD traded units, any movement in the trading prices of the RMB traded units should not directly affect the price of the product, and vice versa. The market price on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange of HKD traded units and RMB traded units may deviate significantly due to a number of factors, including market liquidity, RMB conversion risk, currency risk and the demand and supply of each counter.</li> 
 <li>Suspension of the inter-counter transfer of units between the HKD counter and the RMB counter for any reason may affect adversely to the price for the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Capped Floored Floating Rate Notes (CFFN)
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_69" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 27 Feb 2023)</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>General</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.<br> </li> 
 <li>Capped Floored Floating Rate Notes (CFFN)is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured product involving derivatives.<br> </li> 
 <li>It is principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.<br> </li> 
 <li>The return of this product depends on the performance of the underlying interest rate during the observation period. You must be prepared to take the risk of earning a very low return or no return on the money invested.<br> </li> 
 <li>The Maximum Interest Rate Cap may limit the upside potential of investment return.<br> </li> 
 <li>Market value of the product may fluctuate from time to time. Changes in the underlying interest rate may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product. You are exposed to change in the level of underlying during the scheduled tenor.<br> </li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.<br> </li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.<br> </li> 
 <li>If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.<br> </li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and underlying interest rate movement.<br> </li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for Risk Free Rate</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Risk Free Rates (RFRs) are not free of risk, hence they are considered "near risk-free". RFRs can rise or fall as a result of changing economic conditions and central bank policy decisions.<br> </li> 
 <li>The Coupon for a Note based on an RFR may be calculated based on a series of overnight rates compounded over the relevant interest period. Therefore, the Coupon payable under such a Note may only be known at or near the end of that interest period and it may be difficult for you to estimate reliably the amount of Coupon which will be payable.<br> </li> 
 <li>The market continues to develop the use of, and alternatives to, RFR. Therefore, it is possible that market participants or a significant part thereof may adopt applications of, and /or methodologies for, the calculation of RFR which differ. In such circumstances the Coupon amount with respect to the Notes may differ over time and depending on the calculation and/or methodology used at that time.<br> </li> 
 <li>Daily changes in the RFR may be more volatile than daily changes in comparable benchmark or market rates and, as such, the return or payments on a Note linked to an RFR may fluctuate more than in the case of a Note that is linked to a less volatile rate.<br> </li> 
 <li>The RFR market is still developing. It is possible that future changes to market practice or conventions relating to the use of RFRs may result in the Issuer amending the definition and/or the use of RFR. It cannot be predicted how such future changes may impact the Notes and such changes may have an adverse impact in your investment in the Notes.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for RMB Structured Notes</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.<br> </li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.<br> </li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.<br> </li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.<br> </li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.<br> </li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.<br> </li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.<br> </li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.<br> </li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.<br> </li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>
