            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_73" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">General reminder  </span></strong></p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a business day, the next following day that is a business day. (updated on 6 Nov 2023)</li>
 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li>
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li>
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li>
 <li>The offering documents of the structured notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer.</li>
 <li>If you are subscribing to private placement notes, please note that the private placement note is available to Professional Investors only.</li>
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.<br>  </li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for Risk Free Rate</strong></p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Risk Free Rates (RFRs) are not free of risk, hence they are considered "near risk-free". RFRs can rise or fall as a result of changing economic conditions and central bank policy decisions.</li>
 <li>The Coupon for a Note based on an RFR may be calculated based on a series of overnight rates compounded over the relevant interest period. Therefore, the Coupon payable under such a Note may only be known at or near the end of that interest period and it may be difficult for you to estimate reliably the amount of Coupon which will be payable.</li>
 <li>The market continues to develop the use of, and alternatives to, RFR. Therefore, it is possible that market participants or a significant part thereof may adopt applications of, and /or methodologies for, the calculation of RFR which differ. In such circumstances the Coupon amount with respect to the Notes may differ over time and depending on the calculation and/or methodology used at that time.</li>
 <li>Daily changes in the RFR may be more volatile than daily changes in comparable benchmark or market rates and, as such, the return or payments on a Note linked to an RFR may fluctuate more than in the case of a Note that is linked to a less volatile rate.</li>
 <li>The RFR market is still developing. It is possible that future changes to market practice or conventions relating to the use of RFRs may result in the Issuer amending the definition and/or the use of RFR. It cannot be predicted how such future changes may impact the Notes and such changes may have an adverse impact in your investment in the Notes.<br>  </li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk Disclosure for Currency Linked Note</strong></p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Investing in currency linked structured note is not the same as buying the linked currency directly.</li>
 <li>The return of the product depends on the exchange rate performance of the chosen currencies. Movements in exchange rates can be unpredictable, sudden and drastic, and affected by complex political and economic factors. You must be prepared to take the risk of earning a very low or no return on the money invested.</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_74" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for RMB Structured Notes<br> </strong></p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li>
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li>
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li>
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li>
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li>
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li>
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li>
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li>
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li>
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_76" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>This product is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>The return of this product depends on the Reference Spread. You must be prepared to take the risk of earning a very low return or no return on the money invested.</li> 
 <li>Market value of the product may fluctuate from time to time. Changes in the underlying interest rate may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product. You are exposed to change in the level of underlying during the scheduled tenor.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and underlying interest rate movement.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>

 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.<br> </li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.<br> </li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_21">
    
    

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Inverse Floater Notes
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_84" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 11 Mar 2024)</p>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_21">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_85" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product.</li> 
 <li>This product is NOT equivalent to time deposit. It is a structured product involving derivatives.</li> 
 <li>It is principal protected only at maturity. You should be willing to invest in the product for the entire investment term. The product is not covered by the Investor Compensation Fund.</li> 
 <li>The return of this product depends on the Reference Rate performance and the Variable Coupon Condition You must be prepared to take the risk of earning a very low return or no return on the money invested.</li> 
 <li>The Coupon Cap may limit the upside potential of investment return.</li> 
 <li>Market value of the product may fluctuate from time to time. Changes in the underlying interest rate may not lead to a corresponding change in the market value of the product. You are exposed to change in the level of underlying during the scheduled tenor.</li> 
 <li>If the settlement currency is not your home currency, you may make a gain or loss due to exchange fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Since this product is not listed on any stock exchange, there is no liquid secondary market, you must be prepared to invest in the product for the entire scheduled tenor, or may suffer significant loss.</li> 
 <li>If the issuer becomes insolvent or defaults on its obligations under the product, you can only claim as an unsecured creditor of the issuer.</li> 
 <li>The longer the time gap between trade date and issue date of the product, the longer you will be exposed to the market risks and underlying interest rate movement.</li> 
 <li>There may be conflicts of interest between issuer, its subsidiaries and its affiliates, which maybe adverse to your interests in the product. Issuer will endeavor to comply with applicable laws and regulations to minimise and manage such conflicts of interest. In the worst case scenario, you could lose all of your investment and any interest.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_22" class="accordions-container sm-12">

            <h3 id="2024513439__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Inverse Floater Notes </h3>

        <section id="2024513439__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">

<div id="content_main_columnControl_45">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_86" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>General reminder</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Early sell back prior to maturity is accepted every other Tuesday, or if such day is not a business day, the next following day that is a business day. (updated on 6 Nov 2023)</li> 
 <li>The investment decision is yours but you should not invest in this product unless HSBC staff has explained to you that the product is suitable for you having regard to your financial situation, investment experience and investment objectives.</li> 
 <li>HSBC has not provided any advice on the source of funds for the investment, including (i) new fund (ii) switching out / redemption of existing product(s), if applicable, this is solely based on your decision. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>Our assessment on product suitability is based on information provided by you and you are responsible for ensuring such information is complete, accurate, up-to-date and not misleading so our assessment is not adversely affected. HSBC will not assume any responsibility for information provided by you. (added on 8 Nov 2020)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents of the structured notes provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or any regulatory authority in Hong Kong, and you are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer.</li> 
 <li>If you are subscribing to private placement notes, please note that the private placement note is available to Professional Investors only.</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_87" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for Risk Free Rate</strong><br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Risk Free Rates (RFRs) are not free of risk, hence they are considered "near risk-free". RFRs can rise or fall as a result of changing economic conditions and central bank policy decisions.</li> 
 <li>The Coupon for a Note based on an RFR may be calculated based on a series of overnight rates compounded over the relevant interest period. Therefore, the Coupon payable under such a Note may only be known at or near the end of that interest period and it may be difficult for you to estimate reliably the amount of Coupon which will be payable.</li> 
 <li>The market continues to develop the use of, and alternatives to, RFR. Therefore, it is possible that market participants or a significant part thereof may adopt applications of, and /or methodologies for, the calculation of RFR which differ. In such circumstances the Coupon amount with respect to the Notes may differ over time and depending on the calculation and/or methodology used at that time.</li> 
 <li>Daily changes in the RFR may be more volatile than daily changes in comparable benchmark or market rates and, as such, the return or payments on a Note linked to an RFR may fluctuate more than in the case of a Note that is linked to a less volatile rate.</li> 
 <li>The RFR market is still developing. It is possible that future changes to market practice or conventions relating to the use of RFRs may result in the Issuer amending the definition and/or the use of RFR. It cannot be predicted how such future changes may impact the Notes and such changes may have an adverse impact in your investment in the Notes.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_88" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Risk disclosure for RMB Structured Notes</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are purchasing RMB denominated products, please take note of the following risk factors:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product will be denominated and settled in RMB outside PRC. Its exchange rate and interest rate may be different from RMB in PRC.</li> 
 <li>The risk of RMB exchange rate fluctuation and the limited availability of RMB outside PRC may adversely affect the market value of the product (including any buy-back price during cooling off period or the bank's bid price for market making arrangements), and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>For products which are denominated in a settlement currency other than RMB and linked to reference asset denominated in RMB, if the reference asset is deliverable to investor upon expiry, its value will be subject to the exchange rate fluctuation between the settlement currency and RMB.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.<br> </li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Interest rates for RMB is government controlled. Change in interest rate for RMB in PRC may or may not influence the interest rate for RMB outside PRC. Any interest rate fluctuation for RMB outside PRC may affect the market value of the product.</li> 
 <li>If RMB payment obligation could not be satisfied as a result of a CNY disruption event, such payment maybe settled in HKD as soon as practicable without any interest payable for any delay. Such payment will be a complete discharge of our obligations under the product.<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product risk disclosure for Bonds
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_89" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Last updated 21 Jun 2021)<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_22">
    General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_90" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Bond is NOT equivalent to a time deposit. This is mainly for medium to long term investment.</li> 
 <li>Bond is subject to both the credit worthiness of the bond issuer and the guarantor. In the worst scenario, if the issuer or guarantor defaults on the bond, you might not be able to recover 100% of the principal or receive any coupon. The bondholder has no recourse to HSBC unless HSBC is the issuer or guarantor itself.</li> 
 <li>Credit ratings assigned by credit rating agencies, now or future, do not guarantee the creditworthiness of the issuer or the guarantor. It is not a recommendation to buy, sell or hold bonds. A suspension or variation of any rating to the bonds may adversely affect the price or value of the bonds. (Updated on 9 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>You should be prepared to invest for the full investment tenor; loss may be incurred if you choose to sell the bond prior to maturity or you may not be able to enjoy the same rates of return when you re-invest the funds in other investments. (Updated on 9 Nov 2020)<br> </li> 
 <li>Some bonds may not have active secondary market. It would be difficult or impossible for investors to sell the bond before its maturity or at prices in line with your expectation.</li> 
 <li>The market price of the Bonds may fluctuate with market changes. Factors affecting market price of the bond include, and are not limited to, fluctuations in interest rates, credit spreads and liquidity premiums. Generally, the price of bonds may fall when the interest rates rise. Besides, the fluctuation in yield generally has a greater effect on prices of longer tenor bonds.</li> 
 <li>There may be exchange rate risks if you choose to convert payments on the bond to your home currency.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_23" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_23" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-359683789__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-359683789__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosures for Bonds </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-359683789__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_47">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_48" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_91" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">RMB Bonds</span></strong><br> If you are purchasing RMB denominated bonds, please take note of the following risk factors:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>RMB investment will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_92" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">High Yield Bonds</span></strong><br> If you are subscribing High Yield Bonds. Please take note of the following additional risk disclosure</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>High yield bonds are typically rated below investment grade by a credit rating agency, or unrated. Whilst high yield bonds bear a higher yield opportunity than investment grade bonds, they present greater risks of issuer default, liquidity, volatility and non-payment of principal and interest.</li> 
 <li>The risk of default on principal and / or interest, is greater for high yield bonds due to higher credit risk of the issuer and lower priority of claim by the bond holders in case of issuer default.</li> 
 <li>High yield bonds can sometimes be less liquid than investment-grade bonds, depending on the issuer and the market conditions at any given time. Investors may be difficult to sell the high yield bond before maturity or at prices in line with their expectation compare to listed bond.</li> 
 <li>High yield bonds tend to be more vulnerable to economic cycles and changes in the issuer’s financial conditions or business developments. In particular, during economic downturn, such bonds typically fall more in value than investment-grade bonds as the issuer default risk rises and investors become more risk adverse.</li> 
 <li>Please be aware the concentration risk of investing in bonds issued by the same issuer or companies by the same group. A degrading of any of the group company's credit rating may expose the whole group to contagion risk. Please be also aware the risk of over concentrating investment in the high risk investment products.<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_93" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">General reminder</span></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Past performance, if any, of the Notes are not indicative of future performance. The Notes are not authorized by the Securities and Futures Commission ("SFC") and the relevant offering documentation provided by the issuer have not been reviewed by the SFC. You are advised to exercise caution in relation to the offer. (Added on 24 Jun 2019)</li> 
 <li>The offering documents are not intended to provide tax, legal or other advice. If you are in any doubt, you should obtain independent professional advice.</li> 
 <li>Listing of the Notes is not to be taken as an indication of the merits of the Issuer, the Group or the Notes. In making an investment decision, investors must rely on their own examination of the Issuer, the Group and the terms of the offering, including the merits and risks involved. (Added on 9 April 2018)<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_23">
    UT General
</h3>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_95" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The product is a complex product and you should exercise caution in relation to the product. (Added on 25 Mar 2019)</li> 
 <li>Unit Trusts are NOT equivalent to time deposits. Instead, they are investment products, and some may involve derivatives. You should note that investment involves risks. Past performance, if any, of the fund is not indicative of future performance. (Added on 08 Apr 2019) Value of the investments can fluctuate and is not guaranteed.</li> 
 <li>Unit trusts may be subject to various types of risks, including market, currency, volatility, liquidity, interest rate, credit, downgrading, regulatory and political risks. </li> 
 <li>Investment returns not denominated in your home currency are exposed to exchange rate fluctuations. Rates of exchange may cause the value of investments to go up or down. Further, HKD is currently pegged to USD, any depreciation of USD against other currencies may cause the value of units denominated in HKD to depreciate against such other currencies.</li> 
 <li>Investment in other funds may involve another layer of fees charged at the underlying fund level.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_50" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_96" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">UT – Bond Fund<br>  </span></strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the fund is a fixed income or bond fund, it will be subject to risks associated with investing in bonds, including:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Credit risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Bonds are subject to the risk of the issuer defaulting on its obligations. It should also be noted that credit ratings assigned by credit rating agencies do not guarantee the creditworthiness of the issuer;</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Liquidity risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Some bonds may not have active secondary markets and it would be difficult or impossible for investors to sell the bond before its maturity; and</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Interest rate risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Bonds are more susceptible to fluctuations in interest rates and generally prices of bonds will fall when interest rates rise.</li> 
 <li>It will be subject to a higher degree of risks if it invests in non-investment grade debt securities, distressed debt securities, defaulted debt securities, emerging market debt securities, mortgage and asset-backed securities, debt securities in a limited number of geographical markets or sectors, contingent convertible securities.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Risk of debt securities issued by Special Purpose Vehicle ("SPVs")</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investments in debt securities issued by SPVs may expose the Fund to additional risks such as the credit/default risk of both the SPV and its parent company or associated company.</li> 
 <li>Investments in debt securities of a subordinated nature issued by SPVs will have a lower priority of claim in the event of the relevant issuer’s liquidation or bankruptcy as they rank behind holders of unsubordinated debt securities but before holders of equity securities and is therefore exposed to higher credit / insolvency risk of its counterparties.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Limited time horizon risk and reinvestment risk</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Added on 24 Jun 2019)</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>neither the income nor the capital is guaranteed for investors to invest in the fund with limited time horizon (i.e. up to the Term Date). The fund’s investments may mature prior to the Term Date. The closer the fund is to the Term Date then the greater the investment in replacement shorter-dated securities (with progressively shorter maturities) and cash. Shorter-dated securities or cash may not offer as high a return as the securities they replace. Investors should have regard to the fixed time horizon of the fund in deciding whether investment in the fund is suitable for them.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_97" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – High Yield Bond Fund<br>  </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Funds that primarily invest in high yield bonds are associated with the following risks:  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Risks associated with investment in high yield bonds, such as </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Higher credit risk </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>since they are typically rated below investment grade or are unrated and as such are often subject to a higher risk of issuer default; </li> 
 <li>Vulnerability to economic cycles </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">During economic downturns such bonds typically fall more in value than investment grade bonds as </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(i) investors become more risk averse and (ii) default risk rises.  </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The net asset value of a fund that invests in high-yield bonds may decline or be negatively affected if there is a default of any of the high yield bonds that it invests in or if interest rates change.</li> 
 <li>Some high-yield bond funds may have fees and/or dividends paid out of capital.  As a result, the capital that the fund has available for investment in the future and capital growth may be reduced.</li> 
 <li>Some high-yield bond funds may not distribute dividends, but instead reinvest the dividends into the fund or alternatively, the investment manager may have discretion on whether or not to make any distribution out of income and/or capital of the fund.  Also, a high distribution yield does not imply a positive or high return on the total investment.</li> 
 <li>Other key risks that may relate to the relevant fund including concentration of investments in particular types of specialized debt or a specific geographical region or sovereign securities.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_98" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Equity / Balanced Fund</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>If the fund is an equity fund and it invests in emerging markets, a single market or a limited number of geographical markets, sectors or smaller cap companies, the fund will be subject to higher degree of risk.</li> 
 <li>Balanced fund invests in both fixed income products and equities, will be exposed to risks of both fixed income fund and equity fund as described above.</li> 
 <li>If the fund invests in derivatives, it may be subject to higher volatility; counterparty risk and other additional risks may be involved.</li> 
 <li>If the fund’s investments are concentrated in Greater China, it involves greater risk of loss than investing in more developed markets due to, among other factors, greater concentration, political, tax, economic, foreign exchange, liquidity, market volatility (such as interest rate and price volatility), legal and regulatory risks.</li> 
 <li>If the fund invests in China A-shares and B-shares and make the relevant investment through Shanghai-Hong Kong Stock Connect, Shenzhen-Hong Kong Stock Connect and China A-shares Access Products may involve additional risks.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_99" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Hedged Share Class</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investment in Hedged Classes which do not hedge underlying portfolio currency exposures back to the investor’s own currency may result in the investor taking speculative currency positions which may be volatile and may have a material impact on Unitholders’ returns.</li> 
 <li>A Hedged Class aims to manage the currency risk between the base currency and the customer's chosen Class Currency. Investment in Hedged Classes may protect unitholders against a decrease in the value of the base currency relative to the Class Currency, but it may also preclude unitholders from benefiting from an increase in the value of the base currency relative to the Class Currency. </li> 
 <li>There is no guarantee that (a) any hedging objective will be achieved, or (b) any hedging strategy will fully and effectively eliminate the effects of exchange rate fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>The Fund’s underlying assets may not be hedged either to the base currency of the Fund or to the Class Currency.   Investors will still be subject to currency risks of any underlying investments in the Fund’s portfolio. Investors should note that the implementation of currency hedging strategies (if the customer has chosen a different Class Currency to the base currency) is distinct from the various currency hedging strategies that the Manager may implement at an overall fund portfolio level to manage risks.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_100" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – RMB Currency Risk</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>RMB investment will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties. </li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>The product may suffer significant losses in liquidating the underlying investments, especially if the underlying investments do not have an active secondary market.</li> 
 <li>The Fund offers RMB denominated units of investments. Subscriptions and redemptions for the Fund may involve conversion of currency at the applicable exchange rates. </li> 
 <li>The value of investment is subject to the exchange rate movements between RMB relative to the base currency of the Fund and/or other currency(ies) of the non-RMB-denominated underlying investments.  An investor, may still suffer losses even if there are gains or no losses in the value of the non-RMB-denominated underlying investments and may subject to further losses if the non-RMB-denominated underlying investments falls in value. </li> 
 <li>RMB is not freely convertible and currency conversions are subject to:<br> <br> a) the funds ability to convert into RMB and its availability of sufficient RMB at time of redemption<br> b) possible delays in payment of redemption proceeds or dividends & in case of sizable redemptions the manager has the absolute discretion to delay any payment in respect of redemption of the RMB Classes (up to a maximum of one calendar month from receipt of a properly documented redemption request).<br>  <br> When calculating the net asset value of Units of a RMB denominated Class, the exchange rate for offshore RMB market in Hong Kong, i.e. the CNH exchange rate will be applied, which may be at a premium or discount to the exchange rate for onshore RMB market in the PRC, i.e. the CNY exchange rate, leading to a possible trading costs incurred and investors may suffer losses.<br> <br> For hedged class denominated in RMB, there is no guarantee that currency hedging between RMB and the base currency will be effective.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_101" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Risks associated with Financial Derivative Instruments</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(added on 22 Mar 2021)<strong><u></u></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Risks associated with financial derivative instruments include counterparty/credit risk, greater liquidity risk, valuation risk and volatility risk.</li> 
 <li>The use of derivatives for investment purposes may involve leverage. Leverage can result in a loss significantly greater than the amount invested in derivatives by the Fund leading to a higher risk of significant loss by the Fund.</li> 
 <li>Certain derivatives such as derivatives on currencies may be uncorrelated with the underlying securities held by the Fund. In this regard the Fund may suffer significant losses notwithstanding that there may be no loss in respect of the underlying securities positions (predominantly fixed income securities) held by the Fund Concentration risk / Mainland China market risk</li> 
 <li>If the fund invests in alternative asset classes including hedge fund strategies, private equity or real estate sectors, the fund will involve higher volatility and liquidity risks.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_50">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_24">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="PRDFB"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Product Risk Disclosure for Non-Complex UT
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">

    
    <div class="anchor" id="ut-general"></div>


<h3 class="heading A-TYP14B-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="content_main_heading_24">
    UT General
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_102" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Unit Trusts are NOT equivalent to time deposits. Instead, they are investment products, and some may involve derivatives. You should note that investment involves risks. Past performance, if any, of the fund is not indicative of future performance. Value of the investments can fluctuate and is not guaranteed.</li> 
 <li>Unit trusts may be subject to various types of risks, including market, currency, volatility, liquidity, interest rate, credit, downgrading, regulatory and political risks.</li> 
 <li>Investment returns not denominated in your home currency are exposed to exchange rate fluctuations. Rates of exchange may cause the value of investments to go up or down. Further, HKD is currently pegged to USD, any depreciation of USD against other currencies may cause the value of units denominated in HKD to depreciate against such other currencies.</li> 
 <li>Investment in other funds may involve another layer of fees charged at the underlying fund level.</li> 
 <li>If you choose to invest in share classes with dividends/payouts, the fund may pay dividends/payouts out of capital or gross of expenses. Dividend/payout is not guaranteed and may result in capital erosion and reduction in net asset value. Payout paying classes may make payment out of capital over a long period of time, and may result in a substantial or complete capital erosion over the long term. (added on 12 Aug 2019)<br> </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_25" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_25" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1253239884__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1253239884__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other product risk disclosure for Non-Complex UT </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1253239884__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_51">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_52" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_103" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">UT – Bond Fund<br>  </span></strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the fund is a fixed income or bond fund, it will be subject to risks associated with investing in bonds, including:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Credit risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Bonds are subject to the risk of the issuer defaulting on its obligations. It should also be noted that credit ratings assigned by credit rating agencies do not guarantee the creditworthiness of the issuer;</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Liquidity risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Some bonds may not have active secondary markets and it would be difficult or impossible for investors to sell the bond before its maturity; and</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Interest rate risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Bonds are more susceptible to fluctuations in interest rates and generally prices of bonds will fall when interest rates rise.</li> 
 <li>It will be subject to a higher degree of risks if it invests in non-investment grade debt securities, distressed debt securities, defaulted debt securities, emerging market debt securities, mortgage and asset-backed securities, debt securities in a limited number of geographical markets or sectors, contingent convertible securities.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Risk of debt securities issued by Special Purpose Vehicle ("SPVs")</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investments in debt securities issued by SPVs may expose the Fund to additional risks such as the credit/default risk of both the SPV and its parent company or associated company.</li> 
 <li>Investments in debt securities of a subordinated nature issued by SPVs will have a lower priority of claim in the event of the relevant issuer’s liquidation or bankruptcy as they rank behind holders of unsubordinated debt securities but before holders of equity securities and is therefore exposed to higher credit / insolvency risk of its counterparties.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Limited time horizon risk and reinvestment risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>neither the income nor the capital is guaranteed for investors to invest in the fund with limited time horizon (i.e. up to the Term Date). The fund’s investments may mature prior to the Term Date. The closer the fund is to the Term Date then the greater the investment in replacement shorter-dated securities (with progressively shorter maturities) and cash. Shorter-dated securities or cash may not offer as high a return as the securities they replace. Investors should have regard to the fixed time horizon of the fund in deciding whether investment in the fund is suitable for them.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_104" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – High Yield Bond Fund<br>  </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Funds that primarily invest in high yield bonds are associated with the following risks:  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Risks associated with investment in high yield bonds, such as </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Higher credit risk </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>since they are typically rated below investment grade or are unrated and as such are often subject to a higher risk of issuer default; </li> 
 <li>Vulnerability to economic cycles </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">During economic downturns such bonds typically fall more in value than investment grade bonds as </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(i) investors become more risk averse and (ii) default risk rises.  </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The net asset value of a fund that invests in high-yield bonds may decline or be negatively affected if there is a default of any of the high yield bonds that it invests in or if interest rates change.</li> 
 <li>Some high-yield bond funds may have fees and/or dividends paid out of capital.  As a result, the capital that the fund has available for investment in the future and capital growth may be reduced.</li> 
 <li>Some high-yield bond funds may not distribute dividends, but instead reinvest the dividends into the fund or alternatively, the investment manager may have discretion on whether or not to make any distribution out of income and/or capital of the fund.  Also, a high distribution yield does not imply a positive or high return on the total investment.</li> 
 <li>Other key risks that may relate to the relevant fund including concentration of investments in particular types of specialized debt or a specific geographical region or sovereign securities.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_105" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Equity / Balanced Fund</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>If the fund is an equity fund and it invests in emerging markets, a single market or a limited number of geographical markets, sectors or smaller cap companies, the fund will be subject to higher degree of risk.</li> 
 <li>Balanced fund invests in both fixed income products and equities, will be exposed to risks of both fixed income fund and equity fund as described above.</li> 
 <li>If the fund invests in derivatives, it may be subject to higher volatility; counterparty risk and other additional risks may be involved.</li> 
 <li>If the fund’s investments are concentrated in Greater China, it involves greater risk of loss than investing in more developed markets due to, among other factors, greater concentration, political, tax, economic, foreign exchange, liquidity, market volatility (such as interest rate and price volatility), legal and regulatory risks.</li> 
 <li>If the fund invests in China A-shares and B-shares and make the relevant investment through Shanghai-Hong Kong Stock Connect, Shenzhen-Hong Kong Stock Connect and China A-shares Access Products may involve additional risks.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_106" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – ESG Fund</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> (Added on 29 Nov 2021)</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>There is no guarantee that an investment approach which considers environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors will produce returns similar to those which don't consider these factors. Investments which consider ESG factors may diverge from traditional market benchmarks.</li> 
 <li>In addition, there is no standard definition of, or measurement criteria for environmental, social and governance impact ("SG Impact"). ESG Impact measurement criteria is (a) highly subjective and (b) may vary significantly across and within sectors. </li> 
 <li>HSBC undertakes due diligence when selecting third party fund managers. However, HSBC relies on the ESG Impact measurement criteria reported by third party fund managers and does not conduct its own specific due diligence in relation to ESG Impact measurement criteria. </li> 
 <li>There is no guarantee that: (a) the nature of the ESG Impact of an investment will be aligned with any particular investor's ESG Impact goals; and (b) the stated level or target level of ESG Impact will be achieved.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_107" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Risks associated with the SME Board, ChiNext Board and/or STAR Board</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Added on 23 Nov 2020)<strong><u></u></strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investments in the SME Board, ChiNext Board and/or STAR Board are subject to the following risks and may result in significant losses for the fund. </li> 
 <li>Higher fluctuation on stock prices and over-valuation risk: Listed companies on the SME Board, ChiNext Board and/or STAR Board are usually of emerging nature with smaller operating scale which are subject to higher fluctuation in stock prices and liquidity and have higher risks and turnover ratios than companies listed on the main board. The listed stocks may be overvalued and such exceptionally high valuation may not be sustainable.</li> 
 <li>Differences in regulation applicable to ChiNext Board and STAR Board: The rules and regulations regarding companies listed on ChiNext Board and STAR Board are less stringent in terms of profitability and share capital than those in the main board and SME Board.</li> 
 <li>Delisting risk: It may be more common and faster for companies listed on the SME Board, ChiNext Board and/or STAR Board to delist. </li> 
 <li>Concentration risk applicable to STAR Board: STAR Board is a newly established board and may have a limited number of listed companies during the initial stage. Investments in STAR Board may be concentrated in a small number of stocks and subject the fund to higher concentration risk. </li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_108" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Risks in connection with the investment strategy</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Added on 23 Nov 2020)</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investments in specific themes may not achieve the desired results under all circumstances and market conditions. The investments of the fund may be adjusted among different themes from time to time depending on the market conditions of the respective themes and therefore the fund may incur greater transaction costs than a fund with static allocation strategy. The fund may focus its investments in specific themes, which may increase the concentration risk and may be more volatile than that of a fund having a more diverse portfolio of investments.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_109" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Hedged Share Class</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Investment in Hedged Classes which do not hedge underlying portfolio currency exposures back to the investor’s own currency may result in the investor taking speculative currency positions which may be volatile and may have a material impact on Unitholders’ returns.</li> 
 <li>A Hedged Class aims to manage the currency risk between the base currency and the customer's chosen Class Currency. Investment in Hedged Classes may protect unitholders against a decrease in the value of the base currency relative to the Class Currency, but it may also preclude unitholders from benefiting from an increase in the value of the base currency relative to the Class Currency. </li> 
 <li>There is no guarantee that (a) any hedging objective will be achieved, or (b) any hedging strategy will fully and effectively eliminate the effects of exchange rate fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>The Fund’s underlying assets may not be hedged either to the base currency of the Fund or to the Class Currency.   Investors will still be subject to currency risks of any underlying investments in the Fund’s portfolio. Investors should note that the implementation of currency hedging strategies (if the customer has chosen a different Class Currency to the base currency) is distinct from the various currency hedging strategies that the Manager may implement at an overall fund portfolio level to manage risks.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_110" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – RMB Currency Risk</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>RMB investment will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation and you may suffer loss in principal.</li> 
 <li>Products or underlying investments which are not denominated in RMB are subject to multiple currency conversion costs in making investments and liquidating investments as well as RMB exchange rate fluctuations and bid/offer spreads when assets are sold to meet redemption requests and other capital requirements.</li> 
 <li>The available choice of underlying investments denominated in RMB outside Mainland China is limited. This may adversely affect the return and performance of the product.</li> 
 <li>Products which invest in debt instruments not supported by any collateral are exposed to credit risk of the counterparties. </li> 
 <li>Products which invest in derivative instruments are subject to counterparty risk as the default by derivative issuers, may adversely affect the performance of the product and result in substantial loss.</li> 
 <li>Products which may invest in RMB debt instruments are subject to interest rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect the return and performance of the RMB products.</li> 
 <li>The product may suffer significant losses in liquidating the underlying investments, especially if the underlying investments do not have an active secondary market.</li> 
 <li>The Fund offers RMB denominated units of investments. Subscriptions and redemptions for the Fund may involve conversion of currency at the applicable exchange rates. </li> 
 <li>The value of investment is subject to the exchange rate movements between RMB relative to the base currency of the Fund and/or other currency(ies) of the non-RMB-denominated underlying investments.  An investor, may still suffer losses even if there are gains or no losses in the value of the non-RMB-denominated underlying investments and may subject to further losses if the non-RMB-denominated underlying investments falls in value. </li> 
 <li>RMB is not freely convertible and currency conversions are subject to:<br> <br> a) the funds ability to convert into RMB and its availability of sufficient RMB at time of redemption<br> b) possible delays in payment of redemption proceeds or dividends & in case of sizable redemptions the manager has the absolute discretion to delay any payment in respect of redemption of the RMB Classes (up to a maximum of one calendar month from receipt of a properly documented redemption request).<br>  <br> When calculating the net asset value of Units of a RMB denominated Class, the exchange rate for offshore RMB market in Hong Kong, i.e. the CNH exchange rate will be applied, which may be at a premium or discount to the exchange rate for onshore RMB market in the PRC, i.e. the CNY exchange rate, leading to a possible trading costs incurred and investors may suffer losses.<br> <br> For hedged class denominated in RMB, there is no guarantee that currency hedging between RMB and the base currency will be effective.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_111" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>UT – Risks associated with the MRF arrangement</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Quota restrictions: The Mainland-Hong Kong Mutual Recognition of Funds (MRF) scheme is subject to an overall quota restriction. Subscription of units in the Fund may be suspended at any time if such quota is used up.</li> 
 <li>Failure to meet eligibility requirements: If the Fund ceases to meet any of the eligibility requirements under the MRF, it may not be allowed to accept new subscriptions. In the worst scenario, the SFC may even withdraw its authorisation for the Fund to be publicly offered in Hong Kong for breach of eligibility requirements. There is no assurance that the Fund can satisfy these requirements on a continuous basis.</li> 
 <li>Mainland China tax risk: Currently, certain tax concessions and exemptions are available to the Fund and/or its investors under the MRF regime. There is no assurance that such concessions and exemptions or Mainland tax laws and regulations will not change. Any change to the existing concessions and exemptions as well as the relevant laws and regulations may adversely affect the Fund and/or its investors and they may suffer substantial losses as a result. </li> 
 <li>Different market practices: Market practices in the Mainland China and Hong Kong may be different. In addition, operational arrangements of the Fund and other public funds offered in Hong Kong may be different in certain ways. For example, subscriptions or redemptions of units may only be processed on a day when both Mainland and Hong Kong markets are open, or it may have different cut-off times or dealing day arrangements versus other SFC-authorised funds. Investors should understand these differences and their implications.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Concentration risk / Mainland China market risk</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The Fund invests primarily in securities related to the Mainland China market and may be subject to additional concentration risk. Investing in the Mainland China market may give rise to different risks including political, policy, tax, economic, foreign exchange, legal, regulatory and liquidity risks.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">RMB currency and conversion risks </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>RMB is currently not freely convertible and is subject to exchange controls and restrictions.</li> 
 <li>Non-RMB based investors are exposed to foreign exchange risk and there is no guarantee that the value of RMB against the investors’ base currencies (for example HKD) will not depreciate. Any depreciation of RMB could adversely affect the value of investor’s investment in the Fund.</li> 
 <li>Investors may not receive RMB upon redemption of investments and/or dividend payment or such payment may be delayed due to the exchange controls and restrictions applicable to RMB.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Mainland China Equity risk </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Market risk: The Fund’s investment in equity securities is subject to general market risks, whose value may fluctuate due to various factors, such as changes in investment sentiment, political and economic conditions and issuer-specific factors.</li> 
 <li>Volatility risk: High market volatility and potential settlement difficulties in the Mainland China equity markets may also result in significant fluctuations in the prices of the securities traded on such markets and thereby may adversely affect the value of the Fund.</li> 
 <li>Policy risk: Securities exchanges in Mainland China typically have the right to suspend or limit trading in any security traded on the relevant exchange. The government or the regulators may also implement policies that may affect the financial markets. All these may have a negative impact on the Fund.</li> 
 <li>High stock valuation risk: The stocks listed on the Mainland China stock exchanges may have a higher price-earnings ratio; and such high valuation may not be sustainable and stock prices may fall drastically.</li> 
 <li>Liquidity risk: Securities markets in Mainland China may be less liquid than other developed markets. The Fund may suffer substantial losses if it is not able to dispose of investments at a time it desires.</li> 
 <li>Risk associated with small-capitalisation/mid-capitalisation companies: The stock of small-capitalisaction/mid-capitalisation companies may have lower liquidity and their prices are more volatile to adverse economic developments than those of larger capitalisation companies in general.</li> 
 <li>Risk associated with ChiNext market: <br> <br> Differences in regulations: The rules and regulations regarding securities in the ChiNext market are less stringent in terms of profitability and share capital than those in the main board market.<br> <br> Emerging nature of ChiNext companies: Given the emerging nature of companies listed on the ChiNext market, there is a risk that the securities traded on ChiNext market may be susceptible to higher market volatility compared to securities traded on the main board market.<br> <br> Higher fluctuation on stock prices: Listed companies in the ChiNext market are usually in their preliminary stage of development having a smaller scale and shorter operating history and their stability and resistance to market risks may be lower. Hence, they are subject to higher fluctuation in stock prices as the performance of these companies changes. They are subject to higher risks and higher turnover ratios than companies listed on the main board.</li> 
 <li>Delisting risk: The companies listed on the ChiNext market are generally less resistant to market risks and may experience more fluctuations in their performance. It may be more common and faster for listed companies in the ChiNext market than companies listed on main board and SME board to delist. This may have an adverse impact on the Fund if the companies that it invests in are delisted.</li> 
 <li>Valuation risk: Conventional valuation methods may not be entirely applicable to companies listed in the ChiNext market. There are fewer circulating shares in the ChiNext market as such stock prices may be more susceptible to manipulation and may experience higher fluctuation upon market speculation. Stocks traded on the ChiNext market may be overvalued and such high valuation may not be sustainable.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Mainland debt securities risks</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Volatility and liquidity risks: The Mainland debt securities markets may be subject to higher volatility and lower liquidity compared to more developed markets. The prices of securities traded in such markets may be subject to fluctuations.</li> 
 <li>Counterparty risk: The Fund is exposed to the credit/default risk of issuers of the debt securities that the Fund may invest in.</li> 
 <li>Interest rate risk: Investment in the Fund is subject to interest rate risk. In general, the prices of debt securities rise when interest rates fall, whilst their prices fall when interest rates rise. The Fund is exposed to additional policy risk of potential adjustment by the government to the interbank deposit rate.</li> 
 <li>Downgrading risk: The credit rating of a debt instrument or its issuer may be downgraded subsequent to investment by the Fund. In the event of such downgrading, the value of the Fund may be adversely affected. The Manager may or may not be able to dispose of the debt instruments that are being downgraded.</li> 
 <li>Credit rating agency risk: The credit appraisal system in the Mainland and the rating methodologies employed in the Mainland may be different from those employed in other markets. Credit ratings given by Mainland rating agencies may therefore not be directly comparable with those given by other international rating agencies.</li> 
 <li>Risk associated with urban investment bonds: The Fund may invest in urban investment bonds. Urban investment bonds are issued by local government financing vehicles ("LGFVs"), such bonds are typically not guaranteed by local governments or the central government of the Mainland. In the even that the LGFVs default on payment of principal or interest of the urban investment bonds, the Fund could suffer substantial loss and the net asset value of the Fund could be adversely affected.</li> 
 <li>Risk associated with asset-backed securities: The Fund may invest in asset-backed securities (including asset-backed commercial papers). Asset-backed securities may be highly illiquid and prone to substantial price volatility. These instruments may be subject to greater credit, liquidity and interest rate risk compared to other debt securities. They are often exposed to extension and prepayment risks and risks that the payment obligations relating to the underlying assets are not met, which may adversely impact the returns of the securities.</li> 
 <li>Risk associated with debt securities which are rated BB+ or below by a Mainland credit rating agency or unrated: The Fund may invest in debt securities rated BB+ or below by a Mainland credit rating agency or unrated. Such securities are generally subject to lower liquidity, higher volatility and greater risk of loss of principal and interest than high-rated debt securities.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Risks associated with repurchase and reverse repurchase transactions: </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Manager may enter into repurchase and reverse repurchase transactions for the account of the Fund on the Mainland stock exchanges or in the interbank market.</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>The collateral pledged under the reverse repurchase transactions in the interbank market may not be marked-to-market. In addition, the Fund may suffer substantial loss when engaging in reverse repurchase transactions as there may be delay and difficulties in recovering cash placed out or realizing the collateral, or proceeds from the sale of the collateral may be less than the cash placed with the counterparty due to inadequate valuation of the collateral and market movements upon default of the counterparty.</li> 
 <li>For repurchase transactions, the Fund may suffer substantial loss as there may be delay and difficulties in recovering collateral pledged with the counterparty or the cash originally received may be less than the collateral pledged due to inadequate valuation of the collateral and market movement upon default of the counterparty.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>
